platform_detection.reasoning: Presence of s3 service and AWS naming conventions strongly indicate Amazon Web Services

adaptive_threshold.reasoning: Fallback calculation based on std/mean ratio: 2.25

cve_details.description: A buffer overflow in the Windows 2000 TCP/IP stack allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted packet.
Apache Struts 2.0.0 is vulnerable to remote code execution via maliciously crafted request.
Apache Struts 2.5.16 and 2.5.17 are vulnerable to remote code execution via OGNL injection in the struts2-jquery-plugin.
A remote attacker can trigger a buffer overflow in the Windows NT kernel by sending a specially crafted request to a vulnerable system, potentially allowing execution of arbitrary code.
Buffer overflow in the Windows Shell (Windows 95/98/NT) allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted file.
Microsoft Windows 2000: Remote code execution via a buffer overflow in the TCP/IP stack triggered by a specially crafted network packet.
Apache Struts 2.0.0-2.0.1 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted request that exploits a missing validation of the 'method' parameter in the Struts framework.
Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) vulnerability in Windows 2000 that allows remote code execution via a specially crafted packet.
